The Garmin Forerunner 245 Music is more than capable of handling a route with a distance of 6-8 km and moderate complexity. In fact, it's designed for runners like you who want to track their routes and progress.

**Route Capacity:**

The Forerunner 245 Music can store up to 100 courses or routes, with a maximum of 10,000 points per course. This means you can create routes with multiple turns, loops, and waypoints without worrying about running out of storage space.

**Route Complexity:**

For a 6-8 km route around the lake, you can expect to create a route with around 10-20 waypoints or turns. The watch can easily handle this level of complexity, and you can add more waypoints if needed.

**Route Navigation:**

When you follow the route on the watch, you'll see the route map on the screen, along with turn-by-turn directions and distance to the next waypoint. The watch will also provide audio and vibration alerts when you approach a turn or deviate from the route.

**Battery Life:**

Even with GPS and music playback enabled, the Forerunner 245 Music has a battery life of up to 7 hours in GPS mode with music. This means you'll have more than enough battery life to complete your 6-8 km run around the lake.

**Tips for Creating a Route:**

* **Keep it Simple:** While the watch can handle complex routes, it's still a good idea to keep your route relatively simple, especially if you're new to route creation. Avoid too many tight turns or complex intersections.
* **Use Waypoints:** Add waypoints to mark important points on the route, such as water stations, restrooms, or scenic views.
* **Test the Route:** Before sharing the route with your running group, test it out to ensure it's accurate and easy to follow.

Overall, the Garmin Forerunner 245 Music is more than capable of handling a 6-8 km route around the lake. With its advanced GPS capabilities and route navigation features, you'll be able to create and follow a route with ease.
